SEARCH
Package io.github.elimelt.pmqueue.message

Class MessageSerializer

java.lang.Object
io.github.elimelt.pmqueue.message.MessageSerializer
public class MessageSerializer extends Object
A high-performance serializer for Message objects using direct memory operations. This class provides methods to convert Message objects to and from byte arrays with minimal overhead and maximum performance.

The serialization format consists of:

  • 8 bytes: timestamp (long)
  • 4 bytes: message type (int)
  • 4 bytes: data length (int)
  • n bytes: message data

Performance optimizations include:

  • Thread-local ByteBuffer reuse to minimize allocation
  • Direct memory operations using Unsafe
  • Buffer size doubling strategy for growing buffers

Note: This class is not intended for external use and should only be used by the Message class's serialization mechanism.

  • Method Details

    • serialize

      public static byte[] serialize(Message message) throws IOException
      Serializes a Message object into a byte array. The resulting byte array contains the message's timestamp, type, length, and data in a compact binary format.

      This method uses thread-local direct ByteBuffers to optimize performance and minimize garbage collection pressure. The buffer size automatically grows if needed.

      Parameters:
      message - the Message object to serialize
      Returns:
      a byte array containing the serialized message
      Throws:
      IOException - if the message is null or cannot be serialized
      OutOfMemoryError - if unable to allocate required buffer space

    • deserialize

      public static Message deserialize(byte[] bytes) throws IOException
      Deserializes a byte array into a Message object. The byte array must contain data in the format produced by serialize(io.github.elimelt.pmqueue.message.Message).

      This method creates a new Message object with the original timestamp preserved through anonymous subclassing. The message type and data are extracted from the serialized format using direct memory operations for optimal performance.

      Parameters:
      bytes - the byte array containing the serialized message
      Returns:
      a new Message object with the deserialized data
      Throws:
      IOException - if the byte array is too short, contains invalid length information, or is otherwise malformed
